snippet: Fleeing the banks for fear of losing their euro deposits, many Greeks have stashed cash and valuables under the proverbial mattress, making them vulnerable to thieves.
abstract: Sharp rise in burglaries around Greece may be symptom of rising poverty and unemployment but thieves might also be prompted by knowledge that more people are keeping cash and valuables at home rather than in bank accounts or safe deposit boxes.
lead_paragraph: Fleeing the banks for fear of losing their euro deposits, many Greeks have stashed cash and valuables under the proverbial mattress, making them vulnerable to thieves.

headline.main: Greek Debt Crisis Adds to a Spike in Burglaries and Robberies
headline.print_headline: With Cash Kept Home, Thieves in Greece Seize Their Chance
